docs.snippet: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Aug. 27 -- At least 50 leftists have reportedly been murdered and many more jailed, beaten or harassed since the formation in April of an anti-Communist terror organization known as the Band.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Aug. 27 -- At least 50 leftists have reportedly been murdered and many more jailed, beaten or harassed since the formation in April of an anti-Communist terror organization known as the Band.
docs.abstract: Leftists reptdly terrorized by anti-Communist orgn known as Band; at least 50 reptdly killed, many more have been jailed since Apr; Pres Balaguer denies existence of such group, imputing blame to pol left, but diplomatic and pol sources cite overwhelming evidence of its existence as orgn formed and armed by police to repress extreme left and other Govt opponents; Band reptdly is creation of police chief Maj Gen Perez, estimated to have some 400 members, mostly strong youths trained in use of arms; activities have reptdly spread in recent wks to cities of Santiago, San Cristobal, San Juan de la Maguana and La Romana; ex-Pres Bosch and RC Ch denounce activities; pol murder suspected in death of exiled Popular Movement leader M Gomez in May; his successor F Taylor assassinated in July

headline.main: Armed Band Said to Terrorize Leftists in Dominican Republic

byline.original: By ALAN RIDINGSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia -- The Bolivian Army revolt that raised an anti-Communist Government to power here last week is similar in origin and spirit to the Brazilian military takeover of 1964.
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia -- The Bolivian Army revolt that raised an anti-Communist Government to power here last week is similar in origin and spirit to the Brazilian military takeover of 1964.

headline.main: Rightists On Top but A Long Struggle Looms; Bolivia:

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 6 (AP) -- Members of the Tupamaro guerrilla organization freed 111 prisoners from a maximum security penitentiary today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 6 (AP) -- Members of the Tupamaro guerrilla organization freed 111 prisoners from a maximum security penitentiary today.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros tunnel to Punta Carretas prison near Montevideo and free 111, including Tupamaro leader R Sendic; illus of army troops arriving at jail after prisoners escape; prison break is 2d in less than 2 mos engineered by Tupamaros, who are still holding 6 persons, including Brit Amb Jackson

headline.main: Tupamaros Tunnel to Uruguay Prison and Free 111

docs.snippet: police reptdly apprehend 4-14 escapees in city of Tucuman, Argentina
docs.abstract: police reptdly apprehend 4-14 escapees in city of Tucuman, Argentina

docs.snippet: Prisons Dir Col Cirilo resigns, to be succeeded by Police Inspector Genta; escape leaves only about 40 Tupamaros in Govt custody
docs.abstract: Prisons Dir Col Cirilo resigns, to be succeeded by Police Inspector Genta; escape leaves only about 40 Tupamaros in Govt custody

headline.main: PRISON HEAD RESIGNS IN URUGUAY ESCAPE

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 8 (Reuters) -- Tupamaros urban guerrillas said tonight they would free the British Ambassador, Geoffrey Jackson, because there is "no longer any reason to hold him."
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 8 (Reuters) -- Tupamaros urban guerrillas said tonight they would free the British Ambassador, Geoffrey Jackson, because there is "no longer any reason to hold him."
docs.abstract: Tupamaros say they will free Jackson because there is 'no longer any reason to hold him,' statement delivered to newspaper; escape of 106 imprisoned Tupamaros linked

headline.main: Guerrillas in Uruguay Say They'll Free British Envoy

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 10 -- The British Ambassador, Geoffrey H. S. Jackson, who was released last night after spending eight months as a hostage of the Tupamaro guerrillas, left Uruguay at midday today on the first available flight to Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 10 -- The British Ambassador, Geoffrey H. S. Jackson, who was released last night after spending eight months as a hostage of the Tupamaro guerrillas, left Uruguay at midday today on the first available flight to Europe.
docs.abstract: Jackson leaves Uruguay; illus at airport; does not mention either Govt or captors in farewell statement; Pacheco assigns control of anti-Tupamaro operations to armed forces comdrs; guerrillas still holding 4 hostages

headline.main: British Envoy, Freed by Guerrillas, Leaves Uruguay

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Brit MP J Hart says Chilean Pres Allende, at private meeting with her Sept 1 in Colombia, predicted that Jackson would be released shortly
docs.abstract: Brit MP J Hart says Chilean Pres Allende, at private meeting with her Sept 1 in Colombia, predicted that Jackson would be released shortly

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 11 -- President Jorge Pacheco Areco, whose Government was undermined this week by successes of the urban guerrillas called Tupamaros, today promised to become even tougher in his battle against them.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 11 -- President Jorge Pacheco Areco, whose Government was undermined this week by successes of the urban guerrillas called Tupamaros, today promised to become even tougher in his battle against them.
docs.abstract: Pacheco pledges tougher stand in battle against Tupamaros, assuming personal responsibility for future Uruguayan Govt decisions in fighting guerrillas and econ decline, radio-TV s; contends rules of dem insts have handicapped Govt

headline.main: URUGUAY'S LEADER WARNS ON REBELS; Pacheco Tells Nation He'll Take a Tougher Stand

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to the New York Times
